description: This file defines the StateHandler class within the WPEFramework::Plugin namespace, responsible for managing lifecycle state transitions, including state creation, validation, updates, and event notifications. It contains static methods and static members related to handling lifecycle states and transitions, referencing interfaces and classes like ILifecycleManager, ApplicationContext, State, and StateTransitionRequest.

classes.name: StateHandler
classes.description: A class providing static methods to manage lifecycle state transitions, creation, validation, and event dispatching within the plugin.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description: Initializes the StateHandler, potentially setting up necessary state transition maps or other static resources.

methods.name: changeState
methods.description: Attempts to change the lifecycle state based on a transition request, returning success or failure and providing error reasons.

methods.name: createState
methods.description: Creates and returns a new State object based on the context and desired lifecycle state.

methods.name: isValidTransition
methods.description: Checks if transitioning from a start state to a target state is valid within the allowed transitions.

methods.name: updateState
methods.description: Updates the current state within the context to a new lifecycle state, with error reporting.

methods.name: sendEvent
methods.description: Dispatches an event notifying about a state change from an old lifecycle state to a new one.

methods.name: getStatePath
methods.description: Retrieves the sequence of states leading to a specified lifecycle state.
